content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/springboot-security-simple-jwt is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
Let me start by exploring the repository structure and understanding the current state of the project.

1. First, I'll view the directory structure
2. Check the pom.xml to see the current Java version
3. Run the initial build to see if there are any issues with Java 8
4. Update the necessary configuration files for Java 17
5. Run the build again to verify the migration

Let's start!

	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
	<parent>

		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.2.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath /> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>
	<groupId>com.example</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-security-simple-jwt</artifactId>
	<version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<name>spring-security-simple-jwt</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<properties>

	</properties>

	<dependencies>

			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>

			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>

	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

</project>

Interesting! The build is passing with Java 17 even though the pom.xml specifies Java 1.8. However, to properly migrate to Java 17, I need to:

1. Update the Java version in pom.xml to 17
2. Update Spring Boot version to one that fully supports Java 17
3. Update the JJWT library to a newer version (the old 0.6.0 version may have issues)
4. Handle javax to jakarta namespace migration (required for Spring Boot 3.x)
5. Update test annotations to JUnit 5 if needed

Let me start with updating the pom.xml:

input.old_str:
<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>2.1.2.RELEASE</version>
		<relativePath /> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>
	<groupId>com.example</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-security-simple-jwt</artifactId>
	<version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<name>spring-security-simple-jwt</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<properties>
		<java.version>1.8</java.version>
	</properties>
input.new_str:
<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>3.2.0</version>
		<relativePath /> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>
	<groupId>com.example</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-security-simple-jwt</artifactId>
	<version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<name>spring-security-simple-jwt</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<properties>
		<java.version>17</java.version>
	</properties>

Now I need to update the JJWT dependency to a newer version that's compatible with Spring Boot 3.x:

Text replacement complete and details displayed in console.

		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-api</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-impl</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
			<scope>runtime</scope>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-jackson</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
			<scope>runtime</scope>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>
Now I need to update the Java files to use jakarta.servlet instead of javax.servlet (Spring Boot 3.x uses Jakarta EE):
Now I need to update the JWT parsing logic in JWTFilter.java for the newer JJWT API:
Now I need to update the JWT parsing code to use the new JJWT 0.11.5 API. The API has changed significantly:
Now I need to update the LoginController.java to use the new JJWT API:
Now I need to update the test class to use JUnit 5 annotations (Spring Boot 3.x uses JUnit 5 by default):
Now let's verify the updated pom.xml:

File content displayed in console.
Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
	<modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
	<parent>
		<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
		<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
		<version>3.2.0</version>
		<relativePath /> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
	</parent>
	<groupId>com.example</groupId>
	<artifactId>spring-security-simple-jwt</artifactId>
	<version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
	<name>spring-security-simple-jwt</name>
	<description>Demo project for Spring Boot</description>

	<properties>
		<java.version>17</java.version>
	</properties>

	<dependencies>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-api</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-impl</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
			<scope>runtime</scope>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>io.jsonwebtoken</groupId>
			<artifactId>jjwt-jackson</artifactId>
			<version>0.11.5</version>
			<scope>runtime</scope>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
			<artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
			<scope>test</scope>
		</dependency>
	</dependencies>

	<build>
		<plugins>
			<plugin>
				<groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
				<artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
			</plugin>
		</plugins>
	</build>

</project>

input.command:
cd /tmp/workdir/baseline_strands_min_20260129/springboot-security-simple-jwt && cat > MIGRATION_SUMMARY.md << 'EOF'
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
Successfully migrated the Spring Boot JWT application from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. pom.xml
- Updated Java version from 1.8 to 17
- Upgraded Spring Boot from 2.1.2.RELEASE to 3.2.0
- Updated JJWT library from 0.6.0 (single artifact) to 0.11.5 (modular artifacts):
  - jjwt-api (compile scope)
  - jjwt-impl (runtime scope)
  - jjwt-jackson (runtime scope)

### 2. Java Source Files

#### JWTFilter.java
- Migrated from javax.servlet.* to jakarta.servlet.*
- Updated JJWT parser API from legacy to new builder pattern:
  - Changed from: `Jwts.parser().setSigningKey(key)`
  - Changed to: `Jwts.parserBuilder().setSigningKey(Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(key.getBytes())).build()`
- Added proper key encoding using StandardCharsets.UTF_8
- Updated SignatureException import path

#### LoginController.java
- Updated JJWT builder API for JWT creation:
  - Changed from: `signWith(SignatureAlgorithm.HS256, key)`
  - Changed to: `signWith(Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(key.getBytes()), SignatureAlgorithm.HS256)`
- Added proper key encoding using StandardCharsets.UTF_8

#### JwtApplicationTests.java
- Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5:
  - Removed @RunWith(SpringRunner.class)
  - Changed from org.junit.Test to org.junit.jupiter.api.Test

## Build Verification
✓ mvn clean verify passes successfully
✓ Compiled with Java 17 (major version: 61)
✓ All tests passing
✓ No deprecation warnings for javax.* packages
✓ No JUnit 4 dependencies

## Key API Changes

### Jakarta EE Migration
Spring Boot 3.x requires Jakarta EE 9+ which uses the jakarta.* namespace instead of javax.*

### JJWT 0.11.5 API Changes
The newer JJWT library has a more secure and explicit API:
- Keys must be properly sized for the algorithm
- Builder pattern for parser configuration
- Separate modules for API, implementation, and JSON processing
EOF
cat MIGRATION_SUMMARY.md

content.text:
# Java 8 to Java 17 Migration Summary

## Overview
Successfully migrated the Spring Boot JWT application from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. pom.xml
- Updated Java version from 1.8 to 17
- Upgraded Spring Boot from 2.1.2.RELEASE to 3.2.0
- Updated JJWT library from 0.6.0 (single artifact) to 0.11.5 (modular artifacts):
  - jjwt-api (compile scope)
  - jjwt-impl (runtime scope)
  - jjwt-jackson (runtime scope)

### 2. Java Source Files

#### JWTFilter.java
- Migrated from javax.servlet.* to jakarta.servlet.*
- Updated JJWT parser API from legacy to new builder pattern:
  - Changed from: `Jwts.parser().setSigningKey(key)`
  - Changed to: `Jwts.parserBuilder().setSigningKey(Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(key.getBytes())).build()`
- Added proper key encoding using StandardCharsets.UTF_8
- Updated SignatureException import path

#### LoginController.java
- Updated JJWT builder API for JWT creation:
  - Changed from: `signWith(SignatureAlgorithm.HS256, key)`
  - Changed to: `signWith(Keys.hmacShaKeyFor(key.getBytes()), SignatureAlgorithm.HS256)`
- Added proper key encoding using StandardCharsets.UTF_8

#### JwtApplicationTests.java
- Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5:
  - Removed @RunWith(SpringRunner.class)
  - Changed from org.junit.Test to org.junit.jupiter.api.Test

## Build Verification
✓ mvn clean verify passes successfully
✓ Compiled with Java 17 (major version: 61)
✓ All tests passing
✓ No deprecation warnings for javax.* packages
✓ No JUnit 4 dependencies

## Key API Changes

### Jakarta EE Migration
Spring Boot 3.x requires Jakarta EE 9+ which uses the jakarta.* namespace instead of javax.*

### JJWT 0.11.5 API Changes
The newer JJWT library has a more secure and explicit API:
- Keys must be properly sized for the algorithm
- Builder pattern for parser configuration
- Separate modules for API, implementation, and JSON processing

## Migration Complete ✅

The Spring Boot JWT application has been successfully migrated from Java 8 to Java 17. Here's what was accomplished:

### Key Changes:
1. **Java Version**: Updated from 1.8 to 17 in pom.xml
2. **Spring Boot**: Upgraded from 2.1.2.RELEASE to 3.2.0
3. **JJWT Library**: Migrated from 0.6.0 to 0.11.5 (modular approach)
4. **Jakarta EE**: Migrated from javax.servlet.* to jakarta.servlet.*
5. **JUnit**: Migrated from JUnit 4 to JUnit 5
6. **API Updates**: Updated JJWT API calls to use the new builder patterns with proper key handling

### Build Status:
✅ **BUILD SUCCESS** - All tests pass, and the application compiles with Java 17 (bytecode version 61)
